qas.question: What do friendlies help international teams prepare for?

answers.text: the qualifying or final stages of major tournaments

qas.question: Which type of team lacks time to prepare for tournaments?
What do international leagues' friendlies happen in the middle of?
What concern has caused national associations and clubs to disagree about friendlies?

answers.text: availability of players, who could become injured or fatigued

qas.question: When do international teams not qualify for Friendly's?

plausible_answers.text: national squads generally have much less time together in which to prepare

qas.question: Why are Friendly's nonessential for major tournaments?
Internationals and what other Friendly's mostly take place during club league season
Which type of team has the most time to prepare for tournaments?
What do national associations and clubs agree on when it comes to tournaments?

context: International teams also play friendlies, generally in preparation for <a0_0>the qualifying or <b4_0>final stages of major tournaments<b4_0/><a0_0/>. This is essential, since <a1_0><b5_0><b7_0>national squads<b7_0/><a1_0/> generally have much less time together in which to prepare<b5_0/>. The biggest difference between friendlies at the <b6_0>club<b6_0/> and international levels is that international friendlies mostly take place during <a2_0>club league seasons<a2_0/>, not between them. This has on occasion led to disagreement between national associations and clubs as to the <a3_0><b8_0>availability of players<b8_0/>, who could become injured or fatigued<a3_0/> in a friendly.
